description.narrative: By 2020, communities in target rural and peri-urban areas, small towns, schools and health centres, achieve open defecation free status, with increased access to adequate sanitation services, improved hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, communities in target rural and peri-urban areas, small towns, schools and health centres, achieve open defecation free status, with increased access to adequate sanitation services, improved hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to support GoM partners to accelerate rural sanitation coverage and has piloted new implementation strategies with varying level of success. A key sanitation success of the year was the declaration of the first Mozambique ODF district. UNICEF direct support ensured 1492 communities being declared Open defecation-free (ODF) in 2019 which means that over 570,000 people are living in an ODF environment. Additionally, UNICEF further advance a multi-sectoral stunting reduction initiative. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of health centres with constructed and rehabilitated sanitation facilities
Number of communities certified free of open defecation that integrate standards for protection of girls and women as a result of UNICEF and partner support (leveraged/indirect)
Number of schools with constructed/rehabilitated sanitation facilities
Number of men and women, girls and boys, who gained access to basic sanitation services in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
